info.name: fiskaltrust.Middleware
info.description:
A Postman collection containing examples that demonstrate how to implement common business cases with the fiskaltrust.Middleware.

## Getting Started
This Postman collection is meant as a quickstart guide for working with the Middleware. Please keep in mind that therefore these samples are not covering everything that can be done with the Middleware - for complete information, please refer to our [API documentation](https://docs.fiskaltrust.cloud/doc/interface-doc/doc/general/general.html).

These samples use REST, but the Middleware also supports gRPC and SOAP scenarios. Please refer to our sample repositories on [GitHub](https://github.com/fiskaltrust), and use our [NuGet client packages](https://github.com/fiskaltrust/middleware-interface-dotnet) in case you are working with .NET.

### Prerequisites
In order to use this demo collection, the following prerequisites are required:
- *The fiskaltrust.Middleware* running on your machine, which can be configured and downloaded via the fiskaltrust.Portal ([AT](https://portal.fiskaltrust.at), [DE](https://portal.fiskaltrust.de), [FR](https://portal.fiskaltrust.fr)). Start it (either by running it as a service, or with the `test.cmd` file), and let it run in the background to handle your requests.
- *Your Cashbox Id* is visible in the portal. It is also displayed in the startup console log of the Middleware. 

### Executing the demo requests
After importing the Postman collection, you first need to set the required variables:
- Right-click on the collection and select _Edit_
- Open the _Variables_ tab, and enter the values for `cashbox_id` and `base_url` 
   - **cashbox_id** is a GUID and shown either in the Portal or in the log of the Middleware itself
   - **base_url** is the URL of the Middleware's HTTP endpoint, **without a trailing slash**. This could e.g. look like this: `http://localhost:1500/bda7742e-fb7e-4eb6-b3ee-27e0c48fc316`. Again, this URL is both displayed in the Portal and in the Middleware log.
   - **possystem_id** is the GUID of a POS System configured in the Portal. It's not required to set this value to run the demo, but it's a mandatory field in German and French production scenarios.
   - **access_token** is only required when working with the SignatureCloud (Austria/France only), and also shown in the Portal.

After you configured these two variables, you can easily run the examples by double-clicking them in the "Collections" menu.

For more information about how to use Postman collections, please refer to [their extensive documentation](https://learning.postman.com/docs/postman/collections/intro-to-collections/).

item.description:
# Journal
The _journal_ endpoint allows users to get data from a running Middleware instance, either in a "raw" JSON format, or specifically for the market (e.g. DSFinV-K in Germany). Market-specific journal calls are documented in the respective sections.
Requests that can be used over all markets.

item.name: Single business cases

header.description: Only required when targeting the SignatureCloud
Only required when targeting the SignatureCloud

request.description:
**Cash transaction with RKSV requirement**

ftReceiptCase: `0x4154000000000001`

The fiskaltrust decision tree is being run through, and, if needed, the signature process is started and the cumulative counter adjusted respectively.

An example for a signature being needed, is an "other service" which is paid for with a "credit card".

An example for a case where no signature is needed, is a receipt with only "no own sales" on it which has been paid for by "credit card".

_See also:_
https://docs.fiskaltrust.cloud/doc/interface-doc/doc/appendix-at-rksv/reference-tables/reference-tables.html#type-of-receipt-ftreceiptcase

header.description: Only required when targeting the SignatureCloud
Only required when targeting the SignatureCloud

request.description:
**Not own sales**

ftReceiptCase: `0x4154000000000007`

For tax purposes, a document with exclusively third-party sales is not subject to signature.

In the data, a VAT-rate can be indicated, whereby the gross amount according to the RKSV always has to be recorded in the signature field.

_See also:_
https://docs.fiskaltrust.cloud/doc/interface-doc/doc/appendix-at-rksv/reference-tables/reference-tables.html#type-of-service-ftchargeitemcase

item.name: Germany
Special receipt cases

request.description:
ftReceiptCase: `0x4445000100000003`

Initializes a new fiskaltrust.Middleware instance including the initialization of the used TSE in the background. Depending on the TSE-Type used, this includes different actions (but at least a client will be registered).

On successful initialization, a notification is created which includes Queue ID, SCU ID, and the TSE's certificate and serial number. When the respective governmental regulations are introduced, it will be required to report this notification to the tax administration.

`ftChargeItems` and `ftPayItems` must be empty.

This receipt case works only with the implicit flow flag. Using it without the ftReceiptCaseFlag `0x0000000100000000` ends up in an exception.

_See also:_
https://docs.fiskaltrust.cloud/doc/interface-doc/doc/appendix-de-kassensichv/reference-tables/type-of-receipt-ftreceiptcase.html#type-of-receipt-ftreceiptcase

ftReceiptCase: `0x4445000100000004`

Permanently disables the fiskaltrust.Middleware and the TSE. **This request should only be executed when a POS system is put out of operations, as it's not possible to revert it.** In scenarios where the TSE should not be disabled (e.g. because it is still used by other queues), please add the flag `0x0000000001000000`.

On successful deactivation, a notification is created which includes Queue ID, SCU ID, and the TSE's certificate and serial number. When the respective governmental regulations are introduced, it will be required to report this notification to the tax administration.

`ftChargeItems` and `ftPayItems` must be empty.

This receipt case works only with the implicit flow flag. Using it without the ftReceiptCaseFlag `0x0000000100000000` ends up in an exception.

_See also:_
https://docs.fiskaltrust.cloud/doc/interface-doc/doc/appendix-de-kassensichv/reference-tables/type-of-receipt-ftreceiptcase.html#type-of-receipt-ftreceiptcase

ftReceiptCase: `0x4445000100000002`

Processes a communication and functional test of the fiskaltrust.Middleware. Additionally, this operation must be used to end the "failure mode" of the Middleware.

If you want to end an ongoing transaction without turnover (e.g. all items on a receipt are voided) then please use a regular ftReceiptCase.

`ftChargeItems` and `ftPayItems` must be empty.

This receipt case works only with the implicit flow flag. Using it without the ftReceiptCaseFlag `0x0000000100000000` ends up in an exception.

_See also:_
https://docs.fiskaltrust.cloud/doc/interface-doc/doc/appendix-de-kassensichv/reference-tables/type-of-receipt-ftreceiptcase.html#type-of-receipt-ftreceiptcase

item.name: Zero receipt with TSE info [Nullbeleg mit TSE-Info]

request.description:
ftReceiptCase: `0x4445000100800002`

Processes a communication and functional test of the fiskaltrust.Middleware. Additionally, this operation must be used to end the "failure mode" of the Middleware. Additionally to the normal zero receipt processing, adding the flag `` will query detailed information from the connected TSE device.

The following data will be returned in `ftState` (JSON-serialized):
- PublicKeyBase64
- SerialNumberOctet
- LogTimeFormat
- SignatureAlgorithm
- CertificationIdentification
- FirmwareIdentification
- CurrentState
- CurrentLogMemorySize
- MaxLogMemorySize
- CurrentNumberOfSignatures
- MaxNumberOfSignatures
- CurrentStartedTransactionNumbers
- CurrentNumberOfStartedTransactions
- MaxNumberOfStartedTransactions
- CurrentClientIds
- CurrentNumberOfClients
- MaxNumberOfClients
- CertificatesBase64

`ftChargeItems` and `ftPayItems` must be empty.

This receipt case works only with the implicit flow flag. Using it without the ftReceiptCaseFlag `0x0000000100000000` ends up in an exception.

_See also:_
https://docs.fiskaltrust.cloud/doc/interface-doc/doc/appendix-de-kassensichv/reference-tables/type-of-receipt-ftreceiptcase.html#type-of-receipt-ftreceiptcase

ftReceiptCase: `0x4445000100000007`

Must be sent at the end of the day to be able to be able to perform the DSFinV-K export. 
- If the flag `0x0000000004000000` is not set, this request exports the TSE's logs to the database, both to save memory on the device and to increase the export performance
- If the flag `0x0000000010000000` is not set, this request will close any open transactions. If the flag is set, an exception is raised in case there are open transactions, which should enable the user to handle this case in their own software. 
- If the flag `0x0000000008000000` is set, this request will also update the masterdata after it was changed in the Portal and a CashBox rebuild was triggered. The new masterdata will be effective starting from this moment.

`ftChargeItems` and `ftPayItems` must be empty.

This receipt case works only with the implicit flow flag. Using it without the ftReceiptCaseFlag `0x0000000100000000` ends up in an exception.

_See also:_
https://docs.fiskaltrust.cloud/doc/interface-doc/doc/appendix-de-kassensichv/reference-tables/type-of-receipt-ftreceiptcase.html#type-of-receipt-ftreceiptcase

ftReceiptCase: `0x4445000100000005`

Can be sent at the end of the month to logically separate them, e.g. for easier bookkeeping.
- If the flag `0x0000000004000000` is not set, this request exports the TSE's logs to the database, both to save memory on the device and to increase the export performance
- If the flag `0x0000000010000000` is not set, this request will close any open transactions. If the flag is set, an exception is raised in case there are open transactions, which should enable the user to handle this case in their own software. 
- If the flag `0x0000000008000000` is set, this request will also update the masterdata after it was changed in the Portal and a CashBox rebuild was triggered. The new masterdata will be effective starting from this moment.

`ftChargeItems` and `ftPayItems` must be empty.

This receipt case works only with the implicit flow flag. Using it without the ftReceiptCaseFlag `0x0000000100000000` ends up in an exception.

_See also:_
https://docs.fiskaltrust.cloud/doc/interface-doc/doc/appendix-de-kassensichv/reference-tables/type-of-receipt-ftreceiptcase.html#type-of-receipt-ftreceiptcase

ftReceiptCase: `0x4445000100000006`

Can be sent at the end of the year to logically separate them, e.g. for easier bookkeeping.
- If the flag `0x0000000004000000` is not set, this request exports the TSE's logs to the database, both to save memory on the device and to increase the export performance
- If the flag `0x0000000010000000` is not set, this request will close any open transactions. If the flag is set, an exception is raised in case there are open transactions, which should enable the user to handle this case in their own software. 
- If the flag `0x0000000008000000` is set, this request will also update the masterdata after it was changed in the Portal and a CashBox rebuild was triggered. The new masterdata will be effective starting from this moment.

`ftChargeItems` and `ftPayItems` must be empty.

This receipt case works only with the implicit flow flag. Using it without the ftReceiptCaseFlag `0x0000000100000000` ends up in an exception.

_See also:_
https://docs.fiskaltrust.cloud/doc/interface-doc/doc/appendix-de-kassensichv/reference-tables/type-of-receipt-ftreceiptcase.html#type-of-receipt-ftreceiptcase

Single business cases

request.description:
ftReceiptCase: `0x4445000100000001`

Purchase with cash payment.

_See also:_
https://docs.fiskaltrust.cloud/doc/interface-doc/doc/appendix-de-kassensichv/reference-tables/type-of-receipt-ftreceiptcase.html#type-of-receipt-ftreceiptcase

item.name: POS receipt - Cash payment with 16% VAT [Barverkauf]

request.description:
ftReceiptCase: `0x4445000100000001`

Purchase at different moments with different VAT rates and cash payment.

_See also:_
https://docs.fiskaltrust.cloud/doc/interface-doc/doc/appendix-de-kassensichv/reference-tables/type-of-receipt-ftreceiptcase.html#type-of-receipt-ftreceiptcase

ftReceiptCase: `0x4445000100000012`

Own consumtion with internal material consumtion.

_See also:_
https://docs.fiskaltrust.cloud/doc/interface-doc/doc/appendix-de-kassensichv/reference-tables/type-of-receipt-ftreceiptcase.html#type-of-receipt-ftreceiptcase

ftReceiptCase: `0x4445000100000012`

Consumption by an employee with internal material consumption.

_See also:_
https://docs.fiskaltrust.cloud/doc/interface-doc/doc/appendix-de-kassensichv/reference-tables/type-of-receipt-ftreceiptcase.html#type-of-receipt-ftreceiptcase

ftReceiptCase: `0x4445000100000001`

ftChargeItemCase: `0x4445000000000031`

A customer purchases a product with loyalty points and receives 50%. This corresponds to a discount. If it is not a discount, it can be e.g. a multi-purpose voucher.

_See also:_
- https://docs.fiskaltrust.cloud/doc/interface-doc/doc/appendix-de-kassensichv/reference-tables/type-of-receipt-ftreceiptcase.html#type-of-receipt-ftreceiptcase
- https://docs.fiskaltrust.cloud/doc/interface-doc/doc/appendix-de-kassensichv/reference-tables/type-of-service-ftchargeitemcase.html#type-of-service-ftchargeitemcase

item.name: Cash to customer (receivable) with pay items [Barauszahlung]

request.description:
ftReceiptCase: `0x4445000100000001`

ftPayItemCase: `0x444500000000000E`

This case can be handled both by using pay items only (where one of them will be converted to a business case in the DSFinV-K), or regularly with a charge item (see example below).

_See also:_
- https://docs.fiskaltrust.cloud/doc/interface-doc/doc/appendix-de-kassensichv/reference-tables/type-of-receipt-ftreceiptcase.html#type-of-receipt-ftreceiptcase
- https://docs.fiskaltrust.cloud/doc/interface-doc/doc/appendix-de-kassensichv/reference-tables/type-of-payment-ftpayitemcase.html#type-of-payment-ftpayitemcase

item.name: Cash to customer (receivable) with charge items [Barauszahlung]

request.description:
ftReceiptCase: `0x4445000100000001`

ftChargeItemCase: `0x4445000000000075`

This case can be handled both by using pay items only (where one of them will be converted to a business case in the DSFinV-K, see example above), or regularly with a charge item.

_See also:_
- https://docs.fiskaltrust.cloud/doc/interface-doc/doc/appendix-de-kassensichv/reference-tables/type-of-receipt-ftreceiptcase.html#type-of-receipt-ftreceiptcase
- https://docs.fiskaltrust.cloud/doc/interface-doc/doc/appendix-de-kassensichv/reference-tables/type-of-service-ftchargeitemcase.html#type-of-service-ftchargeitemcase

item.name: Car repair shop: used parts tax [Altteilsteuer]

request.description:
ftReceiptCase: `0x4445000100000001`

ftChargeItemCases: `0x4445000000000011`, `0x4445000000000017`

A car repair shop uses a replacement engine (Rumpf-Motor) during a repair. The tax base is determined according to the rule for old parts taxation and taxed at 19% VAT (https://de.wikipedia.org/wiki/Altteilsteuer).

_See also:_
- https://docs.fiskaltrust.cloud/doc/interface-doc/doc/appendix-de-kassensichv/reference-tables/type-of-receipt-ftreceiptcase.html#type-of-receipt-ftreceiptcase
- https://docs.fiskaltrust.cloud/doc/interface-doc/doc/appendix-de-kassensichv/reference-tables/type-of-service-ftchargeitemcase.html#type-of-service-ftchargeitemcase

ftReceiptCase: `0x4445000100000001`

Agency businesses are not own sales, but sales made on behalf of a 3rd party. According to the DSFinV-K, this business has to be linked to this 3rd party (called 'agency'). To do so, please create the agency in the Portal and reference it's ID with the `AgencyId` property in ftChargeItemCaseData.

_See also:_
- https://docs.fiskaltrust.cloud/doc/interface-doc/doc/appendix-de-kassensichv/reference-tables/type-of-receipt-ftreceiptcase.html#type-of-receipt-ftreceiptcase
- https://docs.fiskaltrust.cloud/doc/interface-doc/doc/appendix-de-kassensichv/procedural-documentation/dsfinv-k-generation.html#single-recordings-module-de-einzelaufzeichnungsmodul

item.description:
# Single business cases
The requests listed in this section demonstrate "single-step" business cases, i.e. cases that can be handled with a single call to the _sign_ endpoint.

item.description:
Mrs. and Mr. M√ºller check into the hotel, consume over several days and then pay separately. During the payment a split of the transaction takes place via cbReceiptReference and cbPreviousReceiptReference.

1. Mrs. and Mr. M√ºller arrive together (room 123401)
2. first overnight stay
3. consumption at the hotel bar
4. second overnight stay

Mrs. and Mr. M√ºller pay separately (split to invoice 5671 and 5672)
5. invoice 5671 (Mrs. M√ºller)
6. invoice 5672 (Mr. M√ºller)

item.description:
The M√ºller and Maier families check in separately at the hotel. They consume separately over several days and in the end the M√ºller family also takes over the bill from the Maier family and pays everything together. During the payment a merge (2x info-internal) takes place via cbReceiptReference and cbPreviousReceiptReference.

1. Fam. M√ºller arrives (room 1234-000001)
2. Fam. Maier arrives (room 4321-000001)
3. overnight stay Fam. M√ºller
4. overnight stay of Fam. Maier
5. Fam. M√ºller consumes at the hotel bar

Fam. M√ºller pays for themself and for Fam. Maier (merge - invoice 6781)
6. Merge room 1234-000001 into invoice 6781
7. Merge room 4321-000001 into invoice 6781
8. payment invoice 6781

item.description:
# Sequence business cases
The requests listed in this section demonstrate "multi-step" business cases, i.e. long running cases that require multiple sign calls and transactions.

# Implicit transaction samples
Implicit transactions automatically create a start- and a finish transaction (based on the regulations for simplified usage (Durchbedienen)). This avoids common problems with long running transactions, and completely abstracts the user of the fiskaltrust.Middleware from handling those cases.

_See also:_
https://docs.fiskaltrust.cloud/doc/interface-doc/doc/appendix-de-kassensichv/cash-register-integration/cash-register-integration.html?q=implicit#the-fiskaltrustsecuritymechanism-implicit-transaction

Updates an open transaction and adds a new article to it. Connected with the ongoind transactions by the _cbReceiptReference_ field. In this case (_update_-transaction), the charge and pay items must contain all the elements that represent the current state of this receipt.

request.description:
ftReceiptCase: `0x4445000000000001`

Finish the transaction and purchase with cash payment. 

In this example, an additional item (a second coffee to go) is added in this receipt to demonstrate that no additional update or delta transaction is needed in this case. However, these transactions _could_ be performed beforehand. In this case, the total of the previous orders does not match the total amount (as the second coffee to go was not "ordered" separately).

_See also:_
https://docs.fiskaltrust.cloud/doc/interface-doc/doc/appendix-de-kassensichv/reference-tables/type-of-receipt-ftreceiptcase.html#type-of-receipt-ftreceiptcase

item.description:
This case shows how to use both the delta- and the update-transaction receipts for demonstration purposes. In real implementations, please decide for either one of the options and stick to it.

The difference between update and delta receipts is that:
- **Update** contains the all items of the receipt, including the ones already sent by earlier updates, and hence "overwrites" the existing state
- **Delta** contains only the items that should be added to the receipt, and will be "merged" with the existing state

item.description:
# Sequence business cases
The requests listed in this section demonstrate "multi-step" business cases, i.e. long running cases that require multiple sign calls and transactions.

# Explicit transaction samples
Explicit transactions do not automatically create a start- and a finish transaction, and hence can be utilized in scenarios where users of the fiskaltrust.Middleware need more control about the exact commands that will be sent to the TSE.

_See also:_
https://docs.fiskaltrust.cloud/doc/interface-doc/doc/appendix-de-kassensichv/cash-register-integration/cash-register-integration.html?q=implicit#the-fiskaltrustsecuritymechanism-explicit-transaction

item.name: Journal

query.description: The timestamp determining where to start the export, in Ticks (optional)
The timestamp determining where to end the export, in Ticks  (optional)

request.description:
ftJournalType: `0x4445000000000002`

This method returns a DSFinV-K .zip file. If the `from` and `to` parameters are not defined, all data will be returned.

_See also:_
https://docs.fiskaltrust.cloud/doc/interface-doc/doc/appendix-de-kassensichv/reference-tables/type-of-journal-ftjournaltype.html

query.description: The timestamp determining where to start the export, in Ticks (optional)
The timestamp determining where to end the export, in Ticks  (optional)

request.description:
ftJournalType: `0x4445000000000003`

This export will read the TAR files from the database. Therefore, the TSE will not be used during this time, and exports will be much faster in most cases. Also, `from` and `to` parameters are supported. If they are not specified, all data will be returned.

_See also:_
https://docs.fiskaltrust.cloud/doc/interface-doc/doc/appendix-de-kassensichv/reference-tables/type-of-journal-ftjournaltype.html

ftJournalType: `0x4445000000000001`

This export will read the TAR files directly from the TSE. Therefore, the TSE will be used during this time and might be locked. Depending on the type of the TSE, this export might take very long.
Due to limitations of some TSEs, `from` and `to` are not supported. Please use the database-based `Journal` call for these cases.

_See also:_
https://docs.fiskaltrust.cloud/doc/interface-doc/doc/appendix-de-kassensichv/reference-tables/type-of-journal-ftjournaltype.html

Payment without knowledge what was paid. Legal document; has to be signed. GT counters are raised.

No charge items must be included, but the total amount must always be zero. A pay item with negative amount and the ftPayItemCase `0x4652000000000011` has to be used therefore.

request.description:
ftReceiptCase: `0x4652000000000008`

List of charge items to be payed. This can be used to inform customers about open items. ftPayitemtype `0x4652000000000011` must be used.

GT counters are not raised. When this receipt case is used, the phrase "document provisoire" is returned within the ftSignatureItems and must be printed on the bill. Every time the bill is reprinted, an upcounting number denoting how may times the bill has been printed is returned and must be printed on the bill. This is then also recorded in the journal. 

Creating a bill and a payment prove does not replace creating a ticket. A ticket or an invoice has to be issued to raise turnover and raise the GT counters as well.

**Signing & chaining:**
- Signed: yes
- Chain and national numbering: _B_

_See also:_
https://docs.fiskaltrust.cloud/doc/interface-doc/doc/appendix-fr-boi-tva-decl-30-10-30/reference-tables/reference-tables.html
